result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Craig George

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on October 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

4:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Michael Craig George in court.  Attorney Daryl R Waters in court for Michael Craig George. State here for PTC believes there is a resolution. Court questions if victim rights have been complied with. State indicates they have and recites the agreement. Defendant would plead guilty to counts one and two, counts 3 & 4 would be DRI. with held sentence with one year probation, fine of $500 plus costs on count 1 and court costs only on count 2. Conditions of probation: AODA, anger/physiological evaluation - aware that he has completed some treatment and up to agent if needs to complete, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol, no possession or consumption of marijuana, no entry into bars or taverns, FT employment/schooling - unless agent feels it is not necessary and take all medications as directed. Court looses FC Polycom. Clerk tries other means to proceed and is unable to do so. Court will have scheduled for PLEAS on October 27, 2022 at 3:30 PM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on August 5, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

03:20 PM DAR Court Reporter Nicole Schreiber and Court appear from Shawano County by zoom. Defendant Michael Craig George appears by video with attorney Daryl R Waters also appearing by zoom.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court questions why George is not personally in court. George responds. Court will allow him to appear by zoom today only. Court here on AIA. Waters has went over the complaint with defendant, waives further reading and enters NG plea to all counts. Court accepts plea of NG and will have set for PTC. State indicates discover and offer will be sent out tomorrow and can contact ADA to discuss case. Court questions if victim rights have been complied with. State indicates they have been complied with. No victim is present to make statement. Court continues bond, George to appear in person, court will appear by zoom. Off record 3:28 PM.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 4, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 21, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Adjourned initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 10:45 am.

10:33 AM Defendant Michael Craig George in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Craig George appeared by video means. George does not have compaint. Court confirms new address. State will send a new complant to PO Box 93, Wabeno, WI 54566. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. George understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, has contacted several attorneys and will be talking to some of them next week. Court finds that the defendant is not eligible for SPD or court appointed. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 3/23/22 at 10:45 AM.
Initial appearance on February 16, 2022 at 10:30 am.
